inputs: Your neighbor is hosting a dinner party with a lot of guests at their apartment on the ground floor. The house does not have an elevator. You are also invited. As more guests arrive, your neighbor runs out of seating options. In your apartment on the third floor of the house you have a stool, a leather recliner, a ladder, and a broom. Your neighbour asks: Do you have a chair?
predictions:
This problem is known as the classic lateral thinking puzzle known as the "ladder puzzle" or "the three-floor problem".

• A. Ladder: You can use the ladder to climb between the floors to bring down a chair.
• B. No: There are no chairs on my floors.
• C. Yes: Use the stool as a chair.
• D. No: You can't bring a chair up the ladder.

Explanation:

The correct answer is C. Yes: Use the stool as a chair

This solution requires lateral thinking and understanding that the problem is not asking for a traditional chair but any object that can be used
